thread.title: Carlo Ancelotti and Xabi Alonso react to 'special' Real Madrid draw
thread.title_full: Carlo Ancelotti and Xabi Alonso react to 'special' Real Madrid draw

title: Carlo Ancelotti and Xabi Alonso react to 'special' Real Madrid draw
text:
Express Sport ranks La Liga stadiums based on their capacity 
"It’ll be exciting for me to go back to Madrid. 
"By the quarter-final stage all the teams are well-known, there are no secrets anymore. Real have a fantastic team, fantastic players and a fantastic coach. 
"It’ll be a difficult game but we’re confident and we have a chance to go through. Little things can be the difference.” 
Ex-Real Madrid midfielder Xabi Alonso will also go up against his former club in his final season before retiring from the game. 
Alonso was also at the Bernabeu club when they won the Champions League three years ago. 
And the Spaniard revealed his initial reaction to the draw. GETTY Ancelotti took over Bayern Munich last summer GETTY Ancelotti guided Real Madrid to Champions League glory in 2014 GETTY Alonso will retire at the end of the season GETTY Alonso played for Real Madrid between 2009 and 2014 
“Wow! It’ll be a great quarter-final between two clubs with great history," he said. 
"It’s perhaps the most difficult draw we could’ve got but any quarter-final match is difficult. 
"Of course it’s particularly special for me. It’ll be nice to play in Madrid again but I also know the Bernabeu is always a tough place to go. 
"But first we have a home game and we want to continue our good run at home and get a good result. We know Madrid well and we’ll be ready.” Related articles
